About Me

Abhijeet Pendyala

Hi there! I am a Machine Learning enthusiast

My Career

Kopernikus Automotive Gmbh, Berlin, Germany

  • Various implementations of 2D objection object detectors like YOLO
  • Yolo with Tensor-RT on jetson Nano and Tx2
  • Adding new objects into AI pipeline, eg. cones, bikes. Writing scripts for data augmentaion
  • Integrating data augmentetion scripts into Keras RetinaNet and Perception stack
  • 3D object detection from monocular images - Literature survey and open source model(s) implementaiton
  • Creating new dataset for special type of object detection and solving edge cases, eg. masked cars in a parking space
  • Participating in autonomous driving race with donkey car
  • 3D Lidar- models Literature survey and open source model(s) implementation
  • Stereo CAM for depth detection
  • Generating synthetic dataset for 2D, 3D object detection from CARLA simulator (Images and Lidar pointclouds)
  • Improving the data pipeline with scripts for Deduplication of images
  • EfficientDet (2d object detection) implementation
  • Creating dataset from parking videos (cropping, datalabeling, active learning)

Aug 2019 to April 2020
Machine Learning Engineer in Perception Team

fish.Icatchapp.com

Data collection and pre-processing

  • Web scraping and collection of Images
  • Data wrangling- cleaning images with wrong labels
  • Synthetic dataset generation
  • Keras Retinanet- BBox data preparation

Deep Learning Models

  • Pytorch Image Regression - length prediction
  • Keras Image Regression - length prediction
  • Multi-task learning - Images and categorical features
  • Key point detection - mouth and tail
  • OCR - reading measurements from ruler
  • Semantic segmentation of fish
  • Deploying web app on Heroku
  • Multi-modal Network - ( dual loss)
  • Conversion to javascript model to deploy on React app

October 2019 to March 2020
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer

  • Developed a novel Non-convex optimization algorithm to attack the rise of model complexity in large-scale kernalized SVMs. The algorithm was an amalgamation of fast approximate training achieved by Budget Maintenance strategies on the number of support vectors and enhanced optimization scheme offered by Adaptive Coordinate Frequency method on Coordinate Descent method by a non-uniform selection of coordinate frequencies.
  • Devised a new stopping criterion for this non-convex problem to halt the optimization algorithm, instead of running it for certain number of epochs.

April 2018 to December 2018
Student Researcher- Master Thesis

Theory of Machine Learning group at Ruhr- Universität Bochum, Germany

Prediction of Damage and Stress hotspots with Machine Learning

  • Worked on designing machine learning models to extract information from microstructural features obtained from damage simulation schemes of materials, which has several advantages over conducting physical experiments.
  • Damage prediction was done using regression models on the simulation data.
  • The location of Stress hotspots in FCC materials under simulated plastic deformation were predicted using classification models of machine learning, and the results were validated with literature

August 2018 to January 2019
Assistant Researcher

chair of ICAMS at Ruhr- Universität Bochum, Germany

  • Worked on machine learning techniques for prediction of fluid properties on simulated data (wind turbine) from openFOAM

January 2019 to March 2019
Assistant Researcher

Chair of Computational fluid dynamics at Ruhr- Universität Bochum

Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, Pune, India

  • Lead a team of 15 Associates, and was responsible for Performing Durability and Development tests of Diesel, Gasoline engines and Transmissions
  • Worked on design and programming scripts of test cycles, engine software calibration with Di- Analyzer, HELIOS and ETAS-INCA
  • Exploratory data analyis of test data, reports preparation and customer presentations

July 2013 to September 2015
R&D Engineer

National Aerospace Labs, Bangalore, India

  • Developed a novel multistep homogenization method (Mathematical model) and programmed it in MATLAB to compute composite properties of Hybrid composite system; carbon fiber polymers reinforced with cylindrical nano-reinforcements such as carbon nanotubes.

July 2012 to December 2012
Scientific researcher/ Software developer Intern
